title: Failed to building wheel for bitarray
body:
Hello, I am trying to install brownie in VSC and I get these errors:
        - ERROR: Failed building wheel for bitarray
        - ERROR: Failed building wheel for lru-dict
Not sure what to do here, any help would be greatly appericiated.

Thanks.
[Brownie_Install_Log.txt](https://github.com/eth-brownie/brownie/files/6987178/Brownie_Install_Log.txt)
Getting some error. Have you found a solution ?

From the included error log:

```bash
ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
     command: 'C:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\python.exe' -u -c 'import sys, setuptools, tokenize; sys.argv[0] = '"'"'C:\\Users\\krunk\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-drnfrm6m\\bitarray_24e9a35921ed420aa2306dd7d9738ea2\\setup.py'"'"'; 
__file__='"'"'C:\\Users\\krunk\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\pip-install-drnfrm6m\\bitarray_24e9a35921ed420aa2306dd7d9738ea2\\setup.py'"'"';f=getattr(tokenize, '"'"'open'"'"', open)(__file__);code=f.read().replace('"'"'\r\n'"'"', '"'"'\n'"'"');f.close();exec(compile(code, __file__, '"'"'exec'"'"'))' install --record 'C:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-record-ptjsk925\install-record.txt' --single-version-externally-managed --compile --install-headers 'C:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\Include\bitarray'         cwd: C:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Temp\pip-install-drnfrm6m\bitarray_24e9a35921ed420aa2306dd7d9738ea2\
    Complete output (19 lines):
    running install
    running build
    running build_py
    creating build
    creating build\lib.win-amd64-3.7
    creating build\lib.win-amd64-3.7\bitarray
    copying bitarray\test_bitarray.py -> build\lib.win-amd64-3.7\bitarray
    copying bitarray\test_util.py -> build\lib.win-amd64-3.7\bitarray
    copying bitarray\util.py -> build\lib.win-amd64-3.7\bitarray
    copying bitarray\__init__.py -> build\lib.win-amd64-3.7\bitarray
    running build_ext
    building 'bitarray._bitarray' extension
    creating build\temp.win-amd64-3.7
    creating build\temp.win-amd64-3.7\Release
    creating build\temp.win-amd64-3.7\Release\bitarray
    C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\BIN\x86_amd64\cl.exe /c /nologo /Ox /W3 /GL /DNDEBUG /MD -IC:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\include -IC:\Users\krunk\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\include "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\INCLUDE" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\ATLMFC\INCLUDE" "-IC:\Program Files (x86)\Windows Kits\10\include\10.0.10240.0\ucrt" /Tcbitarray/_bitarray.c /Fobuild\temp.win-amd64-3.7\Release\bitarray    _bitarray.c
    c:\users\krunk\appdata\local\programs\python\python37\include\pyconfig.h(203): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'basetsd.h': No such file or directory
    error: command 'C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\\VC\\BIN\\x86_amd64\\cl.exe' failed with exit status 2
```

Seems the install fails due to a missing file `basetsd.h`.  It looks like it might be related to an uninstalled dependency. This [Stack Overflow question](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44437357/fatal-error-c1083-cannot-open-include-file-basetsd-h) might be useful? I'm not using Windows myself so I can't be of much more help unfortunately.
